It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with tubular corollas. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest undergrowth, where it thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while the flowers are usually pale pink to white in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
